newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Greater efficiency boosted Portucel - chairman.
newsitem.headline: Greater efficiency boosted Portucel - chairman.

text.p: Greater efficiency in production contributed to Portucel Industrial's swing back into profit in the first half of 1997 and should help it take full advantage of improved market conditions in the rest of the year, chairman Jorge Godinho told Reuters.

"This (improved efficiency) gives us reason to expect that in the second half of the year, when the market is looking much more positive, that the company will benefit even more from these favourable conditions," Godinho said.
Portucel boosted its pulp production 311,000 tonnes in the first half, a 22 percent rise on the same period last year.
Earlier, the company announced a first half consolidated net profit of 752 million escudos against a 2.9 billion loss in the same period last year.
Godinho said that capacity utilisation was much higher than in the same period last year, while costs had fallen.
He said the second quarter of 1997 was much better than the first but prices were still slightly down in the semestre overall when compared with 1996.
He said profit was 705 million escudos in the second quarter against just 47 million in the first.
